notes:
Spark SF062 Peugeot 208 T16 Pikes Peak 2013 Pikes Peak International Hill Climb Test S. Loeb (#97 of 1000)

Purchased: 2014

"Loosely" based on the shape and design of the production 208, the T16 is vehicle that uses the rear wing from the Peugeot 908, and has a 3.2-litre, twin-turbo V6 engine, developing 875 bhp. I think we all know by now what SÃ©bastien Loeb was able to do with this car. Keep in mind that Peugeot created this from scratch in just 6 months. Check out Have Wings, Will Fly: Inside The Peugeot 208 T16 Pikes Peak at Speedhunters for more details. Some fun numbers:

Power to weight ratio: 1:1 875hp/875kg
0-100km/h: 1.8sec
0-200km/h: 4.8sec
top speed: 240km/h

The model is exactly would you would expect from Spark - fantastic. The odd thing is that after the little metal plaque reading "0097 of 1000" fell off (glad that didn't happen in transit) the base read "120/750pcs." I guess I can understand increasing overall production but the 120th piece now being the 97th is odd. Just goes to show that the whole "#x of y" business is kind of silly. Also I really hate photographing black cars. Even when you think it's clean it's not. See some side-by-side (front-to-front, back-to-back, etc.) pictures with the full-color winner here.
